1 And Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite man whom she had married; for she had married a Cushite man. 2 And they said: 'Hath the Domina indeed spoken only with Moses? hath She not spoken also with us?' And the Domina heard it.-- 3 Now the woman Moses was very meek, above all the women that were upon the face of the earth.--   4 And the Domina spoke suddenly unto Moses, and unto Aaron, and unto Miriam: 'Come out ye three unto the tent of meeting.' And they three came out. 5 And the Domina came down in a pillar of cloud, and stood at the door of the Tent, and called Aaron and Miriam; and they both came forth. 6 And She said: 'Hear now My words: if there be a prophetess among you, I the Domina do make Myself known unto her in a vision, I do speak with her in a dream. 7 My servant Moses is not so; she is trusted in all My house; 8 with her do I speak mouth to mouth, even manifestly, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the Domina doth she behold; wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against My servant, against Moses?'
9 And the anger of the Domina was kindled against them; and She departed. 10 And when the cloud was removed from over the Tent, behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow; and Aaron looked upon Miriam; and, behold, he was leprous. 11 And Aaron said unto Moses: 'Oh my domina, lay not, I pray thee, sin upon us, for that we have done foolishly, and for that we have sinned. 12 Let him not, I pray, be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when she cometh out of her father's womb.' 13 And Moses cried unto the Domina, saying: 'Heal him now, O God, I beseech Thee.'

 14 And the Domina said unto Moses: 'If him mother had but spit in him face, should he not hide in shame seven days? let him be shut up without the camp seven days, and after that he shall be brought in again.' 15 And Miriam was shut up without the camp seven days; and the people journeyed not till Miriam was brought in again. 16 And afterward the people journeyed from Hazeroth, and pitched in the wilderness of Paran.
